70$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/7/2012 5:04:18 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$2$2$I was on this for emotional intensity disorder and borderline personality symptoms. I have gained 20 lbs in two weeks and another 3 lbs in past 4 days. The weight gain has happened so fast and my legs/ankles have swelled up so bad I am not having to use compression stockings. I have sever pain in my legs. I have been off of the medication for about 6 days now and the additional 3 lbs has been in last 4 days since I have been off. It's so frustrating to keep getting bigger at such a fast rate. Dr. have ckd my labs, chest xray, etc due to symptoms including shortness of breath. Pain and swelling gets much worse by mid afternoon after I have been standing/walking on my legs. Did really well for my mood, but the side effects had to stop. Following up with my primary dr. to ck wt/pain in two more weeks.

92$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/24/2011 7:28:39 PM$Reviewer: wndydys, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$I have just started this drug today.  But, after reading all the info about it, I am very concerned of the side effects.  I read the reviews from others and it looks like a lot of patients are really unhappy with this medication.  It states severe weight gain.  Does it just automatically make you gain weight or can you control the weight you gain, ie: diet, exercise, etc.?  I dont want to have a heatstroke or diabetes either.  I need something to help my bipolar moods, that are mostly depressed no mania.  I just don't want to have a new illness develop from a medication that I'm taking for my mental well being.  Does anyone have any positive info to give me.
104$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$12/26/2010 8:31:15 PM$Reviewer: SugarFreeQueenBee, 19-24 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$3$I was on Risperidone for 2 years and gained almost 60 pounds. My doctor did a TERRIBLE job alerting me of side affects. It is very detrimental to a person who is already depressed to gain than much weight and be told that you are just not living a healthy lifestyle. It did not calm my anxiety. I was tired all the time, had hot flashes. I was never told the dangers of using this drug long term. 
116$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/28/2010 10:38:52 AM$Reviewer: Hopeful, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$3$5$I have been taking  this drug for 10 years. 149$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$11/17/2009 2:04:24 PM$Reviewer: kate, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I started out taking this med for depression for about a year now and it really helped right away. I have noticed it has helped with other things besides the depression and they are my Tinnitis(ringing in the ears)which I suffered from for ten years and the OCD that went along with the ringing. These disorders disappeared about a week into the risperidole and remain among the missing to this day. I call it my miracle drug. I started out on .05mg and within 3 months time I was taking 2 and a half mgs and would suggest it to anyone that suffers from any depression like disorders.

259$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/15/2017 6:47:57 AM$Reviewer: Gastroparesis Girl, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I use this as both an additional medication to treat depression and also as an additional medication for obsessive compulsive disorder. It works very well for both. I'm on 3 mg and take it at night before bedtime. It helps my mind not race while I'm trying to get to sleep so I can actually sleep now without my mind worrying about a million things that I can't control. I still have anxiety; I'm just wired that way, but it definitely cuts way back on it. It's definitely helped me. I've never had the weight gain from this drug some people talk about. Knock on wood.

282$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/15/2014 10:29:11 AM$Reviewer: lulu'smom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$3$5$Have taken every anti-depressant under the sun for the last 20 years.  Currently on Effexor SR with some relief.  My doctor added Risperdal to help.  I felt absolutely WONDERFUL...I felt like my old self emotionally.  My husband even noticed the change because I had more energy, bounce in my step. It also lessened my anxiety. Unfortunately, I developed breast milk within 2 days of starting the medication, my breast doubled in size, was constantly hungry (gained five lbs within a week), and developed very embarrassing drooling.  I went off the medication and the side effects stopped.  But I'm back to how I was before I started taking this.  I truly wish I could have tolerated the side effects.

column1: 383$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/1/2011 4:54:52 PM$Reviewer: Barbara J
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$I was prescribed this med when I was in a pych. hospital for depression.  I am bipolar.  I questioned the doctor as I don't respond well to many drugs.  (I take Cymbalta and Lamictal with no horrible problems).  He assured me they didn't see side effects with this med unless someone was taking 9ms or more.  I took .50mgs for only 2 days and woke up with a charley horse in my left leg that wouldn't go away. My tongue
column3: head
column5: arms and legs were moving involuntarily. I had had two inch long blood filled places on my legs
column7: but smaller sores in my mouth. I couldn't be understood when I spoke and had a rapid heart rate.  I ended up in the ER.  They gave me something to calm my muscles down and told me I should be back to normal withing 24-48 hours.  I saw my own Psychiatrist the following day; he told me it would be longer as my pupils were still huge.  19 days I suffered with those side effects before they wore off.  My doctor was ticked that it was even prescribed for me
column8: as it is an older drug
column9: not used as much for bipolars because there are others that work better with fewer side effects.  I now have it listed as a drug I am allergic to.  I wouldn't recommend anyone take this without trying everything else first!

column7: was referred to a neurologist ophthalmologist who diagnosed me with Nystagmus in both my eyes
column8: which is a ticking of the eye
column9: much like a pendulum on a clock.  With the help of the drug
column11: the nystagmus is controlled in my front and right vision
column12: but not when I look to my left.  This problem occurred over a year ago
column13: and it appears to be permanent.  This is a horrible drug -- I would not recommend anyone taking it.

column3: i take 0.25mg in the eve. I sleep well

column1: 399$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/14/2011 10:46:57 PM$Reviewer: csim1983
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$1$I am a 27 year old male who from about Fall of 2001 until August 2009 had been on the medication Risperdal. This medicine was crap. If I missed one dose I could not sleep. I was irritable if I did not take it. I gained about thirty pounds while on it. When I dropped it cold turkey I lost thirty pounds within three to four months. After a two week detox period I could sleep normally and was not irritable. It's been a year and a half since I last took and haven't looked back. I used along with risperdal the generic prozac: fluoxetine. I feel my depression is in check and I have a pretty good handle on it without the risperdal.

column1: 420$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/21/2010 3:07:26 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$3$5$I love this medication. I take it along with Lamictal
column2: Citalopram and Xanax. The problem is is makes my breasts lactate all the time. I read another side effect is having problems getting pregnant. Both of these scare me and I am going to see about trying another med. Too bad
column3: Risperdal has really helped me with my anxiety.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$Please beware when taking this drug. My dr put me on 2 mg of this in addition to the 50 mg of Zoloft that I already take. I took 1 pill the first morning with my breakfast at work. Within 30 minutes I felt drunk
column3: could not walk straight and was slurring my words. I had meetings throughout the day so I could not leave. When I got home I slept for 12 hrs. I woke up the next morning and my eyes were still completely dialated. Thank God I didn't get pulled over on the way home. I didn't realize how bad off I really was. I had to call in sick and it took me sleeping that entire next day before I could actually function. This is the worst med I have ever been on!!!!

501$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/13/2009 5:06:05 PM$Reviewer: sconzie40
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$1$5$"I took this drug for a week and I showed some improvement. I was feeling better and not so manic.

column1: However. the side effects of this DRUG put me in the Hospital. After the first couple of days I could not produce any sperm
column2: and I had difficulty swallowing and dry mouth. I just thought that I was maybe getting a sore throat. I hat twitching a little in my face and it made me feel jumpy. I wound up in the hospital because it caused me to get dependent edema in both my feet and I could not breath. I had very short breaths and could not breath properly. I have a feeling that my throat was closing and was causing me to not get enough in my airway. I was in the hospital for 24 hours and they took every test in the book and I am very happy to say that they found nothing wrong with me. They didn't believe me at first that it was the deadly side effects from this drug. I had cut the dosage in half and stopped taking it while I was in there. Just a word of warning
column3: I am also Diabetic
column4: it raised my blood sugar and made me gain 7 pounds in a week. I have made a feel recovery. I can now produce
column5: and my breathing is 90 % back to normal."

column1: 530$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$6/12/2009 1:45:27 PM$Reviewer: concerned mother
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $4$2$4$"Risperdal was prescribed for my 14 year old son who was suffering from depression and having suicidal thoughts while on his anti-depressant (cipram). It helped to calm him down. However had to stop the anti-depressant after 3 months as the combination was making him hyper - he was on 3mg of Risperdal.

column1: After 4 months on risperdal
column2: he started experiencing severe back pain with nausea and vomiting. Doctors did all sorts of tests on him to find the cause of the problem but none believed that Risperdal was causing the problem. I finally took him off it and the symptoms disappeared. However
column3: after a week his aggressiveness returned. I put him back on risperdal but at a lower dose of 1.5 mg. His back pain and nausea returned. He is now on Abilify which so far seems to suit him better.

column1: 538$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/23/2009 2:29:25 AM$Reviewer: 200825
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$4$4$

column1: 540$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/14/2009 8:59:45 AM$Reviewer: emmalea
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been diagnosed with bipolar disorder for years only to live within denial of it believing I was misdiagnosed and only had depressive episodes. I did not have those happy highs
column3: instead I had bouts of anger I could not control. One day I was screaming  at my 16 year old nephew
column4: who never experienced this side of me
column5: and I saw his eyes get big as he asked me why I was acting this way. I decided it was time to get help. A psychiatrist put me on wellbutrin for depression and 1 mg risperdal for anger. I read it was for schizophrenia and bulked at taking it because I know I do not suffer from it. My doctor confirmed I was not but asked me to trust his decision. I'm glad I did and wish I had taken this medication a long time ago. Initially there was some side effects of anxiety but was told to take benydryl to counteract it
column6: which it did. It only lasted the first few days. My outlook is much different
column7: my abnormal anger has subsided. I still get mad but its a normal emotion in response to normal situtations. I sleep through the night
column8: I feel rested and not overly tired anymore
column9: in fact I have more energy. I feel at peace and my family no longer has to walk on tiptoes around me. That is what I am most grateful for because as miserable as I felt
column10: my family suffered more. I have had no wieght gain other than my normal fluctuations
column11: I am geneticly large to begin. This medication has given me a new life.

column1: 542$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/4/2009 6:23:59 PM$Reviewer: Jew-lover.
column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$1$5$This might work for you
column3: but it certainly did not work for me. I became insatiably hungry and gained about 40 pounds. If you try this for the same reason I did then I recommend you find something else as soon as you feel unusually hungry...I take Trileptal now instead of this.If you're like me
column4: your hunger will never diminish 'till weeks and weeks after you quit taking it.

column1: 547$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/6/2009 7:40:30 PM$Reviewer: Jew-lover.
column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$2$5$I
column3: for the first time in my whole life

column1: 551$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$2/24/2009 4:18:25 AM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$after a few attempts with other drugs

column1: 567$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$1/9/2009 10:47:18 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$1$5$"Well
column2: it worked. It helped organize my thoughts
column3: made me feel ""less undone."" It also cause me to *lactate.* That's right. I was told it was a rare side effect. However
column5: I found another instance in less than 5 minutes
column6: so I doubt that it's rare. This is a classic case of the cure being worse than the disease. I'm absolutely disgusted by the lack of proper information and the general lax response I received from the doctor who prescribed it. Something seriously disturbing is going on in the body for drug to make a non-pregnant woman to lactate. The only upside is that it has made me swear off psych medication. I am not a guinea pig. Further investigation should be done on this drug
column7: esp. in light of kick-backs and extreme side-effects.  "

column1: 580$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$12/3/2008 10:06:02 PM$Reviewer: d00d
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been on a Prozac and Risperdal combination for a few years now. It's been a real life saver with the only real side effect being lack of concentration. I wouldn't recommend getting on it though
column3: unless you cannot function at all
column4: as you may very well be on it for the rest of your life.

column3: except for weight gain
column4: but i'm also taking paxil and that causes weight gain too. my psych prescribed it to help me sleep but it hasn't helped at all. i see her tommorrow and hopefully she will change my medicine and try something else.

column1: 607$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/24/2008 8:47:47 AM$Reviewer: Milo
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$My psycho-pharmacologist decided to try having me take small (1.5 mg./day) doses of Risperdal as a mood stabilizer
column3: in addition to my anitdepressant and antianxiety medications. I was concerned at first about taking an antipsychotic
column4: but she reassured me that the pharmacist would know from the small dose that I was not being treated for psychosis. The drug has worked like a charm. I feel calmer
column7: without any side effects that I've noticed. I feel so fortunate to have found a psychiatrist who specializes in pharmacology who keeps up with the latest uses of different medications and is able to try different medicines for different uses.

column1: 628$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/6/2008 12:47:49 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$4$
631$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/20/2008 9:36:40 PM$Reviewer: encyclopedia joyceannica
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been struggling with recurring bouts of depression for years
column3: and suddenly about 6 months ago I started having manic episodes. It scared me to death. My doctor put me on risperdal initially with my anti depressant
column4: but i was still very agitated and racy so she finally just had me take the risperdal alone.  I immediately felt normal again!  I can concentrate
column7: and I don't talk up a storm anymore.  The only thing that bothers me is the lack of sex drive that i have now.  Oh
column8: and the bizzaro lactation.  I'm already weaning off of it
column10: but it has been a huge help in getting my mind back in my control.

column1: 634$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/8/2008 11:43:37 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$After working throught the initial side effects
column2: it was great. The best sleep I've had in years. I did not notice improvement as a mood stabilizer. I would still be taking this
column3: but I haven't had a period in six months and even started producing breast milk!

column1: 655$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$1/27/2008 7:39:56 PM$Reviewer: augustmoots

No improvements in mood - I""m still depressed as hell - but who wouldn't be after losing their children?  I hate this stuff.  I want off."

711$Additional Medications to Treat Depression$8/10/2010 12:41:02 AM$Reviewer: Melody
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$5$I've been receiving treatment for panic attacks and anxiety for a long time. Zoloft and Xanax work very well for me. But there are times when I get so frustrated and feel agitated that even I know there's no reason for feeling like that.  My doctor included Risperdal M-Tab 0.5 to be taken ONLY when I get very frustrated.  They worked very well even though I rarely ever take one.  I'm 56 years old and the possible side effect of sudden death or stroke from use of these tabs creeps me out.  Otherwise
column3: I think it's very helpful.
